thread.title: Judge sets $1,000 bond for woman charged with murder
thread.title_full: Judge sets $1,000 bond for woman charged with murder - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Judge sets $1,000 bond for woman charged with murder
text:
JACKSON, Miss. (AP) - A Hinds County judge has set a $1,000 for a woman charged in the murder of an 81-year-old Pearl man.
During a preliminary hearing Monday, The Clarion-Ledger reports ( http://on.thec-l.com/1hPA32R ) Judge Melvin Priester Sr. sent the case of Loren Blackwell to the grand jury on charges of murder and auto theft before ordering that she be placed on house arrest on the condition that she posts her bail.
The 24-year-old Blackwell was arrested in early September along with 21-year-old Walter Lee Young, who faces the same charges.
The victim, Lee Kendrick, was found shot in the head in an abandoned apartment in northeast Jackson on Sept. 2.
Online jail records do not list an attorney for Blackwell or Young.
Information from: The Clarion-Ledger, http://www.clarionledger.com
